member.name: T:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser
member.summary: StringParser parses a string returnning the (sub)strings between tokens.
member.example:
An example of how to use this class.
[STAThread] static void Main(string[] args) { int currentIndex = 0; string s = ".NET Framework doesn't have a string parsing class?!"; StringParser parser = new StringParser(s, false); while (currentIndex < s.Length) { Console.WriteLine("Returned Index: {0}", currentIndex = parser.ParseNext()); Console.WriteLine("Chars scanned: {0}", parser.CharsParsed); Console.WriteLine("Parsing result: {0}\n", parser.Result); } }
The output:
Returned Index: 5 Chars scanned: 5 Parsing result: .NET
Returned Index: 15 Chars scanned: 10 Parsing result: Framework
Returned Index: 23 Chars scanned: 8 Parsing result: doesn't
Returned Index: 28 Chars scanned: 5 Parsing result: have
Returned Index: 30 Chars scanned: 2 Parsing result: a
Returned Index: 37 Chars scanned: 7 Parsing result: string
Returned Index: 45 Chars scanned: 8 Parsing result: parsing
Returned Index: 52 Chars scanned: 7 Parsing result: class?!

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an instance of StringParser.
member.param: Indicates if parser system should be case-sensitive (true) or case-intensitive (false).

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an instance of StringParser.
member.param: Indicates if parser system should be case-sensitive (true) or case-intensitive (false).
member.remarks: By defining the string (to parse) in constructor you can call directly the method without having to initializate the target string on method. See the example for further details.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses target string attempting to determine the (sub)string between the beginning of this string and the . After the parse is complete system will load into then number of chars scanned and into the string that was found.
member.returns: The index of the char next char after the end.
member.remarks: If nothing is parsed the method will return -1. Case the wasn't found until the end of the string the method retuns (in ) the string found between the starting index and the end of the string.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.Parse(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Parses target string attempting to determine the (sub)string between the index start of this string and the . After the parse is complete system will load into then number of chars scanned and into the string that was found.
member.param: The start index for parsing purposes.
member.returns: The index of the char next char after the Token end.
member.remarks: If nothing is parsed the method will return -1. Case the wasn't found until the end of the string the method returns (in ) the string found between the starting index and the end of the string.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.ParseNext
member.summary: Repeats the parsing starting on the index returned by method. You can also call ParseNext directly (without calling ) if you define the text to be parsed at instance construction.
member.returns: The index of the char next char after the end.
member.remarks: If nothing is parsed the method will return -1. Case the wasn't found until the end of the string the method returns (in ) the string found between the starting index and the end of the string.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the substring in the string. If the substring does not exists the method returns -1.
member.returns: The index of the substring or -1 if the string does not exists within the source string. If the the substring is empty method returns 0.
member.remarks: The instance parses for the substring in a case sensitive or intensive way, as you specify at class construction.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.IndexOf(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the index of the substring in the string starting on index startIndex. If the substring does not exists the method returns -1.
member.param: The start index of the source string where parser will start.
member.returns: The index of the substring or -1 if the string does not exists within the source string. If the the substring is empty method returns startIndex.
member.remarks: The instance parses for the substring in a case sensitive or intensive way, as you specify at class construction.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Isql.StringParser.ToString
member.summary: Overrided method that returns the string to be parsed.
member.returns: The string to be parsed.

member.name: T:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbBackup
member.summary: Back up a database to a file or tape device. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.p: Paths of backup files are relative to the server. Since the Services Manager executes backup and restore tasks on the server host, the Services Manager reads and writes backup files on the server host.

The username and password used to connect to the services manager will be used to connect to the database for backup. This helps add some degree of security for this operation. Only the SYSDBA user or the owner of the database will be able to backup a database.

member.name: T:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig
member.summary: Parameters and values in the firebird.conf file on the server.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.LockMemSize
member.summary: Bytes of shared memory allocated for lock manager.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.LockSemCount
member.summary: Number of semaphores for interprocess communication.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.EventMemorySize
member.summary: Bytes of shared memory allocated for event manager.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.LockGrantOrder
member.summary: When a connection wants to lock an object, it gets a lock request block which specifies the object and the lock level requested. Eack locked object has a lock block. Request blocks are connected to those lock blocks either as requests that have been granted, or as pending requests.

remarks.para: The settings:
1 means locks are granted first come, first served.
0 means emulate InterBase v3.3 behavior, where locks are granted as soon as they are available; can result in lock request starvation.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.LockHashSlots
member.summary: Tune lock hash list; more hash slots mean shorter hash chains. Only necessary under very high load. Prime number values are recommended.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.DeadlockTimeout
member.summary: Determines the number of seconds that the lock manager will wait after a conflict has been encountered before purging locks from dead processes and doing extra deadlock scan cycle. Engine detects deadlocks instantly in all normal cases, so this value affects things only if something goes wrong. Setting it too low may degrade system performance.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.LockRequireSpins
member.summary: In Classic, only one client process may access the lock table at any time. Access to the lock table is governed by a mutex. The mutex can be requested conditionally -a wait is a failure and the request must be retried - or unconditionally - the request will wait until it is satisfied. This parameter establishes the number of attempts that will be made conditionally. Relevant only on SMP machines.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Seconds to wait before concluding an attempt to connect has failed.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.DummyPacketInterval
member.summary: Seconds to wait on a silent client connection before the server sends dummy packets to request acknowledgment.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.IpcMapSize
member.summary: Size in bytes of one client's portion of the memory mapped file used for local connections.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbServerConfig.DefaultDbCachePages
member.summary: Number of cached database pages.

member.summary: Shut down the database after the specified number of seconds; to shut down the database immediately, set the shutdown interval to 0.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.Services.FbShutdownMode.DenyTransaction

The validation operation cannot guarantee to repair all cases of corruption. Do not rely on database validation as a disaster recovery policy in lieu of making regular backups of your database.

member.summary: Represents an SQL statement or stored procedure to execute against a data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.p: It's strongly recommend to call Dispose method for free the memory allocated by the Firebird Server, when the command is no more needed.
The FbCommand class provides the following methods for executing commands against a Firebird database:

item.description: Executes commands such as SQL INSERT, DELETE, UPDATE, and SET statements.
Retrieves a single value (for example, an aggregate value) from a database.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbCommand.CommandText
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL statement or stored procedure to execute.
member.value: The SQL statement or stored procedure to execute. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.para: When the property is set to StoredProcedure, the CommandText property should be set to the name of the stored procedure. The user may be required to use escape character syntax if the stored procedure name contains any special characters. The command executes this stored procedure when you call one of the Execute methods.
The Firebird .NET Data Provider support the question mark (?) placeholder and named parameters for passing parameters to a SQL Statement or a stored procedure.

For example you can do:
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE CustomerID = @CustomerID
or
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE CustomerID = ?

member.name: T:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbCommandBuilder
member.summary: Automatically generates single-table commands used to reconcile changes made to a DataSet with the associated data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: The does not automatically generate the SQL statements required to reconcile changes made to a DataSet associated with the data source. However, you can create an FbCommandBuilder object that generates SQL statements for single-table updates by setting the SelectCommand property of the . Then, the FbCommandBuilder generates any additional SQL statements that you do not set.

To generate INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statements, the FbCommandBuilder uses the property to retrieve a required set of metadata. If you change the value of after the metadata has been retrieved (for example, after the first update), you then should call the method to update the metadata.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbCommandBuilder.GetInsertCommand
member.summary: Gets the automatically generated object required to perform insertions at the data source.
member.returns: The automatically generated object required to perform insertions.

remarks.para: You can use the GetInsertCommand method for informational or troubleshooting purposes because it returns the object to be executed. You can also use GetInsertCommand as the basis of a modified command.

After the SQL statement is first generated, you must explicitly call if it changes the statement in any way. Otherwise, the GetInsertCommand still will be using information from the previous statement, which might not be correct. The SQL statements are first generated when the application calls either Update or GetInsertCommand.

After the SQL statement is first generated, you must explicitly call if it changes the statement in any way. Otherwise, the GetUpdateCommand still will be using information from the previous statement, which might not be correct. The SQL statements are first generated when the application calls either Update or GetUpdateCommand.

Note:
Although you cannot change the or QuoteSuffix properties after an insert, update, or delete command has been generated, you can change their settings after calling the Update method of an .

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbConnection.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged and, optionally, the managed resources used by the object.
member.param: True for dispose managed and unmanaged resources and false for dispose only the unmanaged resources.

remarks.para: This method is called by the public Dispose() method and the Finalize method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the disposing parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose with disposing set to false.

When the disposing parameter is true, the method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this FbConnection references. It does this by invoking the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbConnection.Close
member.summary: Closes the connection to the database. This is the preferred method of closing any open connection.

remarks.para: The method rolls back any pending transactions and drops active statments. It then releases the connection to the connection pool, or closes the connection if connection pooling is disabled. If Close is called while handling a event, no additional events are fired.
can be called more than one time without generating an exception.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a connection to a Firebird database.
member.value: The connection string that includes the source database path and name, and other parameters needed to establish the initial connection. The default value is an empty string.
member.exception: An invalid connection string argument has been supplied or a required connection string argument has not been supplied.

remarks.para: The following table lists the valid names for keyword values for ConnectionString property.

item.description: Database path to establish the connection.
Password for the Firebird user account.
Server name for establish the connection.
Port number in the server for establish the connection.
Size (in bytes) of network packets used to communicate with an instance of Firebird Server.

When a connection is returned to the pool, its creation time is compared with the current time, and the connection is destroyed if that time span (in seconds) exceeds the value specified by connection lifetime.
The minimun number of connections allowed in the pool.
The maximun number of connections allowed in the pool.
When true, the FbConnection object is drawn from the appropriate pool, or if necessary, is created and added to the appropriate pool. Recognized values are true, false, yes, and no.
Indicates the number of rows that will be fetched at the same time on calls into the internal row buffer.

When 0 the provider will use the GDS implementation used for connections to Firebird Super or Classic servers, when 1 the provider will use the GDS implementation used for connections to the Firebird embedded server.

remarks.para: The following table lists the valid names for the Charset keyword of the ConnectionString:

item.description: American Standard Code for Information Interchange.
MS-DOS United States, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa.

member.name: T:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataAdapter
member.summary: Represents a set of data commands and a connection to a data source that are used to fill the DataSet and update the data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: The FbDataAdapter, serves as a bridge between a DataSet and FirebirdSQL for retrieving and saving data. The FbDataAdapter provides this bridge by mapping Fill, which changes the data in the DataSet to match the data in the data source, and Update, which changes the data in the data source to match the data in the DataSet, using the appropriate DSQL statements against the data source.
FbDataAdapter is used in conjunction with and to increase performance when connecting to a FirebirdSQL Server database.
The FbDataAdapter also includes the , , , UpdateCommand, and TableMappings properties to facilitate the loading and updating of data.
When an instance of FbDataAdapter is created, the read/write properties are set to initial values.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataAdapter.SelectCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets an SQL statement or stored procedure used to select records in the data source.
member.value: An that is used during a fill operation to select records from data source for placement in the DataSet.

remarks.para: When SelectCommand is assigned to a previously created , the FbCommand is not cloned. The SelectCommand maintains a reference to the previously created FbCommand object.
If the SelectCommand does not return any rows, no tables are added to the DataSet, and no exception is raised.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataAdapter.InsertCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets an SQL statement or stored procedure used to insert new records into the data source.
member.value: An used during an update operation to insert records in the data source that correspond to new rows in the DataSet.

remarks.para: During Update, if this property is not set and primary key information is present in the DataSet, the InsertCommand can be generated automatically if you set the property and use the . Then, any additional commands that you do not set are generated by the FbCommandBuilder. This generation logic requires key column information to be present in the DataSet.
When InsertCommand is assigned to a previously created , the FbCommand is not cloned. The InsertCommand maintains a reference to the previously created FbCommand object.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataAdapter.UpdateCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets an SQL statement or stored procedure used to update records in the data source.
member.value: An used during an update operation to update records in the data source that correspond to modified rows in the DataSet.

remarks.para: During Update, if this property is not set and primary key information is present in the DataSet, the UpdateCommand can be generated automatically if you set the property and use the . Then, any additional commands that you do not set are generated by the FbCommandBuilder. This generation logic requires key column information to be present in the DataSet.
When UpdateCommand is assigned to a previously created , the FbCommand is not cloned. The UpdateCommand maintains a reference to the previously created FbCommand object.

member.name: T:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataReader
member.summary: Provides a Way for reading a forward-only stream of rows. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: This class cannot be instatiated directly, to create a FbDataReader, you need to call the method of a object.

Until the FbDataReader is closed using the method of of the FbDataReader, the associated is busy busy serving the FbDataReader, and no other operations can be performed on the other than closing it. This is the case until the method is called.
To retrieve output parameters you must close the FbDataReader.
and are the only properties that you can call after the FbDataReader is closed.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataReader.Finalize
member.summary: Attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the Object is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataReader.Close
member.summary: Closes the object.

remarks.para: You must explicitly call the Close method when you are using the to use the associated for any other purpose.
The Close method fills in the values for output parameters, return values, increasing the amount of time it takes to close a FbDataReader.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataReader.NextResult
member.summary: Advances to the next result, when reading the results of batch DSQL statements.
member.returns: true if there are more result sets; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Used to process execution of batch DSQL statements.
By default, the data reader is positioned on the first result.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataReader.Read
member.summary: Advances the to the next record.
member.returns: true if there are more rows; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The default position of the is prior to the first record. Therefore, you must call Read to begin accessing any data.

Only one FbDataReader per can be open at a time, and any attempt to open another will fail until the first one is closed. Similarly, while the FbDataReader is in use, the associated FbConnection is busy serving it until you close the by call method.

member.name: M:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbDataReader.GetSchemaTable
member.summary: Returns a DataTable that describes the column metadata of the .
member.returns: A DataTable that describes the column metadata.
member.exception: The is closed.

item.description: The name of the column; this might not be unique. If this cannot be determined, a null value is returned. This name always reflects the most recent renaming of the column in the current view or command text.
The ordinal of the column. Columns are numbered starting with one. This column cannot contain a null value.
The maximum possible length of a value in the column. For columns that use a fixed-length data type, this is the size of the data type.

If ProviderType is a numeric data type, this is the maximum precision of the column. The precision depends on the definition of the column. If ProviderType is not a numeric data type, this is a null value.
If ProviderType is is DECIMAL or NUMERIC data type, the number of digits to the right of the decimal point. Otherwise, this is a null value.
Maps to the .NET Framework type of the column.
The indicator of the column's data type. If the data type of the column varies from row to row, this must be Object. This column cannot contain a null value.
True if the column contains a BLOB that contains very long data; otherwise false.
True if the column allows null values; otherwise false.
True if the column cannot be modified; otherwise false.
Set if the column contains a persistent row identifier that cannot be written to, and has no meaningful value except to identity the row.
true if the the column is one of a set of columns of a unique key.
true if the the column is one of a set of columns of a primary key.
true if the column assigns values to new rows in fixed increments; otherwise false. The default of this column is false.
True if the column name is an alias; otherwise false.
True if the column is an expression; otherwise false.
As Firebird doesn't support Schemas this column will be always NULL.
As Firebird doesn't support Catalogs this column will be always NULL.
The name of the table or view in the data store that contains the column. A null value if the base table name cannot be determined. The default of this column is a null value.

The name of the column in the data store. This might be different than the column name returned in the ColumnName column if an alias was used. A null value if the base column name cannot be determined or if the rowset column is derived, but not identical to, a column in the data store. The default of this column is a null value.

member.summary: Establish a new Save point for the current transaction with the given name.
member.exception: An error occurred while trying to commit the transaction.
The transaction has already been committed or rolled back.
FbCommand is currently busy Open, Fetching.

remarks.para: Savepoints offer a mechanism to roll back portions of transactions. You create a savepoint using the Save method, and then later call the method to roll back to the savepoint instead of rolling back to the start of the transaction.

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransaction.Connection
member.summary: Gets the object associated with the transaction, or a null reference if the transaction is no longer valid.
member.value: The object associated with the transaction.
member.remarks: A single application may have multiple database connections, each with or without a transaction. This property allow you to know the connection object associated with a specific transaction created by .

member.name: P:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransaction.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the IsolationLevel for this transaction.
member.value: The IsolationLevel for this transaction. The default is ReadCommitted.
member.remarks: Parallel transactions are not supported. Therefore, the IsolationLevel applies to the entire transaction.

member.name: T:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions
member.summary: Specifies Firebird transactions specific options that can be used with BeginTransaction.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Consistency
member.summary: Table locking transaction model.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Concurrency
member.summary: High concurrency transaction with acceptable consistency. The use of this parameter takes full advantage multi-generational transaction model.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Shared
member.summary: Concurrent, shared access of a specified table among all transactions. Used with LockRead and Lock Write options to establish the lock option.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Protected
member.summary: Concurrent, restricted access of a specified table. Used with LockRead and Lock Write options to establish the lock option.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Exclusive
member.summary: Exclusive access of a specified table.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Wait
member.summary: Lock resolution specifies that the transaction is to wait until locked resources are released before retrying an operation.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.NoWait
member.summary: Lock resolution specifies that the transaction is not to wait for locks to be released, but instead, a lock conflict error should be returned immediately.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Read
member.summary: Read-only access mode that allows a transaction only to select data.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.Write
member.summary: Read-write access mode of that allows a transaction to select, insert, update, and delete table data.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.LockRead
member.summary: Read only access of a specified table. Used with Shared, Protected and Exclusive options to establish the lock option.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.LockWrite
member.summary: Read/write access of a specified table. Used with Shared, Protected and Exclusive options to establish the lock option.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.ReadCommitted
member.summary: High throughput, high concurrency transaction that can read changes committed by other concurrent transactions. The use of this parameter takes full advantage multi-generational transaction model.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.RecVersion
member.summary: Enables an ReadCommitted transaction to read the most recently committed version of a record even if other, uncommitted versions are pending.

member.name: F:FirebirdSql.Data.Firebird.FbTransactionOptions.NoRecVersion
member.summary: Enables an ReadCommitted transaction to read only the latest committed version of a record. If an uncommitted version of a record is pending and Wait is also specified, then the transaction waits for the pending record to be committed or rolled back before proceeding. Otherwise, a lock conflict error is reported at once.
